Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Anchovy \An*cho"vy\ ([a^]n*ch[=o]"v[y^]), n. [Sp. anchoa, anchova, or Pg. anchova, prob. of Iberian origin, and lit. a dried or pickled fish, fr. Bisc. antzua dry: cf. D. anchovis, F. anchois.] (Zo["o]l.) A small fish, about three inches in length, of the Herring family ({Engraulis encrasicholus}), caught in vast numbers in the Mediterranean, and pickled for exportation. The name is also applied to several allied species. [1913 Webster]

anchovy n 1: tiny Mediterranean fishes usually canned or salted; used for hors d'oeuvres or as seasoning in sauces 2: small herring-like plankton-feeding fishes often canned whole or as paste; abundant in tropical waters worldwide
